> On 7/26/05, Dave Brosius <dbrosius@...> wrote:
> > I =
have it in my head that the junit folks recommend always calling 
> > super=
.setUp/tearDown from a user declared setUp/tearDown, 
> even if the 
> > JU=
nit test in question is directly derived from TestCase. However i 
> > cann=
ot find any written (web page) recommendation to so. Is 
> this still 
> > =
the case? Is there a documented recommendation some where?
> 
> Even if you=
 cannot find the page, this is definitely a good 
> idea. If you decide at =
a later time to have your test case 
> extend something besides TestCase, y=
our invocations of 
> super.setUp/tearDown will already be in place.

Yup, =
it's the best way, but it's unfortunate that JUnit forces you to do
that, b=
ecause having to call super is a clear design smell in OO design
(because i=
f somebody subclasses your class and forget to call super, it will
break). =
 In short, it defeats the purpose of polymorphism.
